N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 755.1 - Ambulatory surgery definition

State Regulations

An ambulatory surgery service is a service organized to
provide those surgical procedures which need to be performed for safety reasons
in an operating room on anesthetized patients requiring a stay of less than 24
hours' duration. These procedures do not include those outpatient surgical
procedures which can be performed safely in a private physician's office or an
outpatient treatment room. Ambulatory surgery services may be provided in a
free-standing ambulatory surgery center or a hospital-based ambulatory surgery
center. Hospital-based ambulatory surgery centers may be on-site or off-site, as described in section
405.20
of this Title. The
provisions of this Part shall be applicable to free-standing ambulatory surgery
centers and off-site hospital-based ambulatory surgery
centers. Notes
